newsitem.title: SPAIN: Bank of Spain sees Q1 GDP up around 2.7 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Spain sees Q1 GDP up around 2.7 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Spanish gross domestic product (GDP) in the first quarter of 1997 may have increased by around 2.7 percent versus the year-earlier quarter, the central bank estimated in its first quarter report, released on Friday.
Data from National Statistics Institute INE showed that GDP rose a provisional 2.6 percent year-on-year in the fourth quarter of 1996.
The Bank of Spain also estimated domestic demand growth at more than 1.5 percent year-on-year in the first quarter, versus 1.4 percent growth as announced by INE in the previous quarter.

"This evaluation is based on more dynamic private --rather than public-- consumption, and a recovery in the impulse of capital goods investment, while at the same time the fall in construction investment continues to soften," the report said.
Exports are still increasing at a "remarkable" rate, although lower than in the fourth quarter when they grew 12.1 percent year-on-year, while imports "seem to have picked up".
If this trend is confirmed, exports' contribution to GDP will have been high in the first quarter, although below the fourth quarter rate, the central bank said.
Inflation, which fell to a 29-year low of 2.2 percent year- on-year in March, was approaching the bank's medium term target of 2.0 percent, it said.
